Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "Please calm down. How could the police or an ambulance get to an isolated island inside a typhoon? I'm sure the phones are out anyway, so please calm yourself."
Umineko Project (UP): "Please calm down. How could the police or an ambulance get to an isolated island in the middle of a typhoon? I'm sure the phones are out anyway, so please calm yourself."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Please calm down. How could the police or an ambulance get to an isolated island inside a typhoon? I'm sure the phones are out anyway, so please calm yourself."
PC Japanese (JP): 「どうか落ち着いて下さい。台風の孤島で、どうやって警察と救急車が来てくれるって言うんです？　どうせ電話は不通にされてるんですから、落ち着いて下さい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「どうか落ち着いて下さい。台風の孤島で、どうやって警察と救急車が来てくれるって言うんです？　どうせ電話は不通にされてるんですから、落ち着いて下さい」
Russian (RU): "Успокойтесь. Как полиция или скорая доберётся до уединённого острова в разгар тайфуна? Всё равно телефоны наверняка не работают, так что успокойтесь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Acalme‐se. Como a polícia ou uma ambulância vai vir até uma ilha isolada em meio à um tufão? Tenho certeza que os telefones estão sem linha, então se acalme."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「請千萬鎮靜一下。您說，在台風中的孤島，警察與救護車是要怎麼來呀？反正電話肯定不通，所以請鎮靜。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「请千万镇静一下。您说，在台风中的孤岛，警察与救护车是要怎么来呀？反正电话肯定不通，所以请镇静。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Per favore calmati. Come potrebbe arrivare la polizia o un'ambulanza su un'isola isolata dal tifone? Sono sicura che anche i telefoni siano fuori uso, quindi per favore calmati."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...Those who left to take a break didn't come back, so the adults went to the parlor. When they did, the door was sealed from the inside, and they couldn't open it. You'll see later, but the hat stand in the parlor had been used to bar the double doors from the inside."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Those who left to take a break didn't come back, so the adults went to the parlor. When they did, the door was sealed from the inside, and they couldn't open it. As they would learn later, the hat stand in the parlor had been used to bar the double doors from the inside."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Those who left to take a break didn't come back, so the adults went to the parlor. When they did, the door was sealed from the inside, and they couldn't open it. You'll see later, but the hat stand in the parlor had been used to bar the double doors from the inside."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……小休止に出た人間が戻らないので、大人たちが客間へ行ったところ、扉が内から閉ざされて開かなかった。後にわかるが、客間内の帽子掛けが観音開きの扉に、内側からかんぬきにされていた。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……小休止に出た人間が戻らないので、大人たちが客間へ行ったところ、扉が内から閉ざされて開かなかった。後にわかるが、客間内の帽子掛けが観音開きの扉に、内側からかんぬきにされていた」
Russian (RU): "......Ушедшие на перерыв не вернулись, и взрослые пошли в гостиную. Когда они пришли, дверь была перекрыта изнутри, и у них не вышло открыть её. Позже ты увидишь, но двойные двери перекрыты из гостиной держателем шляп."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Aqueles que saíram para fazer um intervalo não haviam voltado ainda, por isso os adultos decidiram ir para a sala de visitas. Nisto, perceberam que a porta havia sido selada por dentro, e não poderia ser aberta. Logo depois, eles descobriram que o cabide para chapéus, que ficava na sala de visitas, havia sido usado como uma barra para trancar as portas duplas por dentro."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……由於稍事休息時出去的人沒回來，大人們去了客廳，發現門被反鎖打不開。這個是後來知道的，客廳裡的帽架被人用來當門閂地插在了雙開式門的內側。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……由于稍事休息时出去的人没回来，大人们去了客厅，发现门被反锁打不开。这个是后来知道的，客厅里的帽架被人用来当门闩地插在了双开式门的内侧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Coloro che se n'erano andati per fare una pausa non sono tornati, quindi gli adulti sono andati nel soggiorno. Quando l'hanno fatto, la porta era sigillata dall'interno, e non potevano aprirla. Lo vedrai in seguito, ma l'appendiabiti nel soggiorno era stato usato per sbarrare le doppie porte dall'interno."

Steam (ST): "So you're trying to say that the door was blocked from the inside, and the windows were also locked from the inside...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "So you're trying to say that the door was blocked from the inside, and the windows were also locked from the inside...?"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então está querendo dizer que a porta foi bloqueada por dentro, e as janelas também estão fechadas pelo lado de dentro...?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是想说，门被反锁，而窗户也是从内侧上了锁吧…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Quindi stai cercando di dire che la porta era serrata dall'interno, e che anche le finestre erano chiuse dall'interno...?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "That's it. ...When they went around and looked into the parlor through the window, they saw Rosa lying on the sofa in an unnatural position, with blood pouring from her forehead. ...They then smashed the glass, entered the parlor, and discovered that Maria was also there, lying by the wall and covered in blood."
Umineko Project (UP): "That's it. ......When they went around and looked into the parlor through the window, they saw Rosa lying on the sofa in an unnatural position, with blood pouring from her forehead. ......They then smashed the glass, entered the parlor, and discovered that Maria was also there, lying by the wall and covered in blood."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そういうことだ。……外に回り、窓から客間内を見たところ、楼座がソファーに不自然な格好で横になり、額から血を流しているのが見えた。……そこでガラスを割って客間に入り、他に真里亞も、壁際に血まみれで倒れているのを発見した」
Russian (RU): "Да. ......Выйдя наружу и заглянув в гостиную через окно, они увидели Розу, лежащую на диване в неестественном положении, с текущей изо лба кровью. ......Они разбили стекло, вошли в гостиную и также обнаружили там Марию, которая лежала у стены вся в крови."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Isso mesmo. ......Quando estavam andando pelo lado de fora e olharam para dentro da sala de visitas através da janela, eles viram Rosa deitada em uma posição nada natural, com sangue escorrendo pela sua testa. ......Eles quebraram o vidro, entraram na sala de visitas e descobriram que Maria também estava ali, recostada contra a parede e coberta de sangue."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是的。……繞到外面，從窗戶往客廳裡一看，看到了樓座以不自然的姿勢躺在沙發上，額頭淌血。……接著他們打碎玻璃進了客廳，此外還發現了，真里亞也渾身是血地倒在了牆角。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是的。……绕到外面，从窗户往客厅里一看，看到了楼座以不自然的姿势躺在沙发上，额头淌血。……接着他们打碎玻璃进了客厅，此外还发现了，真里亚也浑身是血地倒在了墙角。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Esatto. ... Dopo essere usciti e aver visto nel soggiorno attraverso la finestra, hanno visto Rosa sul divano in una posizione innaturale, con sangue che le scorreva dalla fronte. ... Hanno quindi rotto il vetro, e scoperto che anche Maria era lì, poggiata al muro ricoperta di sangue."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "The entrance wasn't locked when you came into the mansion because they went out through it to check the parlor from the outside. ...It had been locked before they left through it, so there was a chance that the others who had gone missing were lying elsewhere within the mansion, and the adults are now searching the entire building..."
Umineko Project (UP): "The entrance wasn't locked when you came into the mansion...because they had gone out through it to check the parlor from the outside. ......Since the entrance was locked before the adults went through it, they thought that the other people who had gone missing might be somewhere within the mansion in a similar condition, so they're now searching the entire building..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The entrance wasn't locked when you came into the mansion...because they had gone out through it to check the parlor from the outside. ......Since it had been locked before they went out of it, and there was a chance that the other people who had gone missing were lying elsewhere within the mansion, the adults are now searching the entire building..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ヱリカが屋敷に入った時、玄関が施錠されていなかったのは、この客間を外から確認するために出入りがあったからだ。……その直前までは施錠されていた為、他にも姿を消した人間たちが、屋敷内のどこかで倒れている可能性があるとして、大人たちは今、屋敷中を探し回っている…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ヱリカが屋敷に入った時、玄関が施錠されていなかったのは、この客間を外から確認するために出入りがあったからだ。……その直前までは施錠されていた為、他にも姿を消した人間たちが、屋敷内のどこかで倒れている可能性があるとして、大人たちは今、屋敷中を探し回っている…」
Russian (RU): "Когда ты пришла в особняк, вход не был заперт... потому что они вышли, чтобы проверить гостиную извне. ......Поскольку до их ухода особняк был заперт, и другие пропавшие люди тоже могут лежать где‐то там, сейчас взрослые обыскивают всё здание..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A entrada não estava trancada quando você chegou à mansão...porque eles haviam saído para verificar a sala de visitas pelo lado de fora. ......Como a entrada estava trancada antes dos adultos saírem por ela, eles pensaram que as outras pessoas desaparecidas poderiam estar em algum lugar da mansão, em condições semelhantes, e assim saíram procurando por toda a edificação..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「在繪梨花進大屋時大門沒鎖的原因是，為從外面看看客廳室內，大家曾出入過大門。……由於在這之前門一直鎖著，所以其他失踪之人也可能是倒在了大屋內的某處，大人們現正在大屋中，四處搜尋…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「在绘梨花进大屋时大门没锁的原因是，为从外面看看客厅室内，大家曾出入过大门。……由于在这之前门一直锁着，所以其他失踪之人也可能是倒在了大屋内的某处，大人们现正在大屋中，四处搜寻…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "L'ingresso non era chiuso quando sei arrivata alla villa... poiché erano usciti per controllare il soggiorno dall'esterno. ... Dato che era stata chiusa prima che ne uscissero, e c'era la possibilità che le altre persone scomparse giacessero in altri punti della villa, gli adulti stanno ora perlustrando l'intero edificio..."

Speaker: Furudo Erika

Steam (ST): Normally, with the detective's authority, Erika had the right to openly investigate the crime scenes to her heart's content.
Umineko Project (UP): Normally, with the detective's authority, Erika had the right to openly investigate the crime scenes to her heart's content.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Normally, with the detective's authority, Erika had the right to openly investigate the crime scenes to her heart's content.
PC Japanese (JP): 本来ならば、探偵権限を持つヱリカは、堂々と心行くまで現場を検証する権利を持つ。
Russian (RU): Обычно с полномочием детектива Эрика имела право открыто исследовать места преступлений до полного удовлетворения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Normalmente, com sua autoridade do detetive, Erika teria o direito de investigar abertamente as cenas dos crimes o quanto quisesse.

Steam (ST): However, this time, she hadn't yet made use of that authority. ...She was a guest and an outsider, so there was little to no chance that she would be allowed to investigate.
Umineko Project (UP): However, this time, she hadn't yet invoked that authority. ......Because of that, and with her being a guest and an outsider, there was little to no chance that she would be allowed to investigate.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, this time, she hadn't yet made use of that authority. ......Because of that, and with her being a guest and an outsider, there was little to no chance that she would be allowed to investigate.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし今回は、その探偵権限をまだ行使していない。……その為、客人という名の部外者に、殺人現場の検証が許されるわけがないのだ。
Russian (RU): Но в этот раз она ещё не ввела это полномочие. ......Из‐за этого, а также из‐за её положения гостьи и посторонней ей вряд ли позволят вести расследование.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, desta vez, ela ainda não havia invocado sua autoridade. ......Por causa disso, e por sua existência ser a de uma convidada e também uma intrusa, praticamente não haviam oportunidades que a permitissem investigar as coisas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過本次，她尚未行使這個偵探權限。……因此，叫做客人的外人，不可能被允許勘察殺人現場。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过本次，她尚未行使这个侦探权限。……因此，叫做客人的外人，不可能被允许勘察杀人现场。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, stavolta, non aveva ancora sfruttato quell'autorità. ... A causa di ciò, e anche perché si trattava di un'ospite e di un'estranea, c'erano scarse possibilità che le fosse permesso di investigare.

Steam (ST): So, she was forced to quickly check all of the crime scenes now, while she could still run about as she pleased.
Umineko Project (UP): So, she was forced to quickly check all of the crime scenes now, while she could still run about as she pleased.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, she was forced to quickly check all of the crime scenes now, while she could still run about as she pleased.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、自由に動き回れる今の内に、大急ぎで全ての現場を確認しなければならない。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, ela se forçou a verificar todas as cenas dos crimes agora, enquanto ainda podia correr pelo local o quanto quisesse.

Speaker: Dlanor
Steam (ST): "Lady {f:5:Erika}, ...I believe you know, but allow me to warn you just in {f:5:case}."
Umineko Project (UP): "Lady {f:5:Erika}, ......I believe you know, but allow me to warn you just in {f:5:case}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Lady Erika, ......I believe you know, but allow me to warn you just in CASE."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ヱリカ卿、……ご存知とは思いますが、念の為、ご忠告をいたしマス。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ヱリカ卿、……ご存知とは思いますが、念の為、ご忠告をいたしマス」

Speaker: Dlanor
Steam (ST): "It is true that you have an incredible photographic {f:5:memory}, Lady {f:5:Erika}. ...That, combined with the detective proclamation, is what made it possible for you to avoid being deceived by {f:5:anything}."
Umineko Project (UP): "It is true that you have an incredible photographic {f:5:memory}. ......When you combine that with the detective's proclamation, it becomes impossible for you to be fooled by {f:5:anything}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It is true that you have an incredible photographic memory, Lady Erika. ......By combining that with the detective's proclamation, it is impossible for you to be fooled by ANYTHING."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ヱリカ卿は、確かに写真並みの驚くべき記憶力をお持ちデス。……それは探偵権限と組み合わさることで、何物にも欺かれぬものと成り得マシタ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ヱリカ卿は、確かに写真並みの驚くべき記憶力をお持ちデス。……それは探偵権限と組み合わさることで、何物にも欺かれぬものと成り得マシタ」
Russian (RU): "У вас действительно невероятная фотографическая {f:5:память}, леди {f:5:Эрика}. ......Если объединить её с полномочием детектива, вас невозможно одурачить."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É verdade que você possui uma incrível memória {f:5:fotográfica}. ......Quando combina isso com a sua proclamação do detetive, se torna impossível que alguma coisa a {f:5:engane}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「艾莉卡卿，您的確是擁有著相當於照片的驚人的記憶力。……它通過與偵探權限相結合，成為了不會被任何東西所欺的能力。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「艾莉卡卿，您的确是拥有着相当于照片的惊人的记忆力。……它通过与侦探权限相结合，成为了不会被任何东西所欺的能力。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "È vero che possiede un'incredibile memoria fotografica, Lady Erika. ... Combinando ciò con la proclamazione del detective, è impossibile che qualcosa la tragga in INGANNO."

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "Yeah, I get it. ...Since no detective proclamation has been made about me, even my photographic memory doesn't count as foolproof evidence. Of course, I understand that. ...Still, that doesn't mean I can afford to miss viewing the crime scenes directly."
Umineko Project (UP): "Oh, I know what you're going to say. ......Since I haven't made the detective proclamation, even my photographic memory could potentially be fooled. Of course, I understand that. ......Still, that doesn't mean I can afford to go without viewing the crime scenes directly."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yeah, I get it. ......Since no detective proclamation has been made about me, even my photographic memory doesn't count as foolproof evidence. Of course, I understand that. ......Still, that doesn't mean I can afford to miss viewing the crime scenes directly."
PC Japanese (JP): 「あぁ、わかってます。……探偵宣言をしていない私は、写真並みの記憶力を持っていても、欺かれない保証はないってわけですね。もちろん、理解していますとも。……かといって、現場を直接視認しないわけには行きませんから。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あぁ、わかってます。……探偵宣言をしていない私は、写真並みの記憶力を持っていても、欺かれない保証はないってわけですね。もちろん、理解していますとも。……かといって、現場を直接視認しないわけには行きませんから」
Russian (RU): "Да, знаю. ......Пока я не провозглашена детективом, даже моя фотографическая память не считается надёжным доказательством. Разумеется, я понимаю. ......И всё же, это не значит, что можно не осматривать места преступлений напрямую."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ah, já sei onde quer chegar. ......Já que eu não fiz uma proclamação do detetive, até mesmo minha memória fotográfica poderia ser potencialmente enganada. É claro, eu entendo. ......Ainda assim, isso não significa que eu não possa ir analisar as cenas dos crimes diretamente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「啊，明白。……沒進行偵探宣言的我，縱然擁有相當於照片的記憶力，也沒法打保票說不會受騙。我當然有理解這一點。……不過話雖如此，我可不能不去直接視察現場。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「啊，明白。……没进行侦探宣言的我，纵然拥有相当于照片的记忆力，也没法打保票说不会受骗。我当然有理解这一点。……不过话虽如此，我可不能不去直接视察现场。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sì, ho capito. ... Poiché non ho fatto nessuna proclamazione del detective, persino la mia memoria fotografica non può contare come prova infallibile. Ovviamente, comprendo appieno. ... Però, ciò non significa che mi possa permettere di evitare l'osservazione delle scene del crimine in modo diretto."

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "...After all, in the last game, my pride in that regard led me to a truly miserable failure."
Umineko Project (UP): "......After all, in the last game, my pride in that regard led me to commit a truly agonizing blunder."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......After all, in the last game, my pride in that regard led me to a truly miserable failure."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……前回のゲームでは、そこに慢心し、悔やみ切れぬ失態を犯しましたから。」

Russian (RU): "......В конце концов, в прошлой игре моя заносчивость в этом деле привела к поистине досадной ошибке."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Afinal, no último jogo, meu orgulho disso acabou me levando a cometer um erro verdadeiramente agoniante."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……畢竟，在上盤遊戲中，我就是在這事上麻痹大意，才犯下了悔都悔不盡的失態。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……毕竟，在上盘游戏中，我就是在这事上麻痹大意，才犯下了悔都悔不尽的失态。」

Speaker: Dlanor
Steam (ST): "For example, by this argument, no matter how well you examine a person's corpse, you could not even guarantee that they were not faking their death with absolute {f:5:certainty}. Most probably, features of this situation must be individually confirmed by telling Battler to repeat them in {f:5:red}."
Umineko Project (UP): "To take an extreme case, no matter how well you examine a person's corpse right now, the possibility will always remain that they were faking their {f:5:death}. It will probably be necessary to give Battler repetition requests to confirm the details of each situation {f:5:individually}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "For example, by this argument, no matter how well you examine a person's corpse, you could not even guarantee that they were not faking their death with absolute CERTAINTY. Most probably, features of this situation must be individually confirmed by telling Battler to repeat them in red."
PC Japanese (JP): 「極論、今のヱリカ卿は、どれほど検死をしようとも、死んだフリを見破れない可能性が常に残るということです。全ての状況を個別に確定させるためにも、戦人に復唱要求をする必要があるでしょう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「極論、今のヱリカ卿は、どれほど検死をしようとも、死んだフリを見破れない可能性が常に残るということです。全ての状況を個別に確定させるためにも、戦人に復唱要求をする必要があるでしょう」
Russian (RU): "К примеру, как бы вы ни осматривали труп человека, вы даже не можете с абсолютной точностью гарантировать, что он не подделал свою {f:5:смерть}. Видимо, придётся просить Баттлера повторить красным {f:5:особенности} ситуации."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Considerando um caso extremo, não importa o quanto você examine o cadáver de uma pessoa agora, sempre vai existir a possibilidade de que estavam fingindo suas {f:5:mortes}. Provavelmente será necessário fazer um pedido de repetição requisitada ao Battler para confirmar os detalhes de cada ocorrência {f:5:individualmente}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「極端地講，不論現在的艾莉卡卿驗多少次屍，都是永遠存在著未能識破裝死的可能性。要個別確定所有的狀況，也必須依靠對戰人的複述要求吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「极端地讲，不论现在的艾莉卡卿验多少次尸，都是永远存在着未能识破装死的可能性。要个别确定所有的状况，也必须依靠对战人的复述要求吧？」

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "And I'll need to use the blue truth liberally in order to make him. ...I understand. Let's start with the basics. ...The lack of the detective's authority is no handicap. It simply means that I'm fighting under the same conditions Battler once was."
Umineko Project (UP): "And I'll need to use the blue truth liberally in order to draw those out of him. ......I know that. Let's start with the basics. ......The lack of the detective's authority is no handicap. It simply means that I'm fighting under the same conditions Battler once was."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "And I'll need to use the blue truth liberally in order to make him. ......I understand. Let's start with the basics. ......The lack of the detective's authority is no handicap. It simply means that I'm fighting under the same conditions Battler once was."
PC Japanese (JP): 「それを引き出すために、青き真実を駆使しなくてはなりませんね。……わかってます。基礎を充分に、基本から攻めましょう。……探偵権限などなくてもハンデにはなりません。かつての戦人と同じ条件で戦っているだけなんですからっ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「それを引き出すために、青き真実を駆使しなくてはなりませんね。……わかってます。基礎を充分に、基本から攻めましょう。……探偵権限などなくてもハンデにはなりません。かつての戦人と同じ条件で戦っているだけなんですからっ」
Russian (RU): "А чтобы заставить его, мне нужно будет не скупясь использовать синюю правду. ......Знаю. Начнём с основ. ......Отсутствие полномочия детектива не помеха. Это всего лишь означает, что я борюсь в тех же условиях, что и Баттлер когда‐то."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E vou precisar usar a verdade azul de forma liberal para conseguir tirar isso dele. ......Eu sei disso. Vamos começar com o básico. ......A falta da autoridade do detetive não é uma colher de chá. Simplesmente significa que eu estou lutando sob as mesmas condições que o Battler lutou no passado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「而要誘他爆料，乃是必須去運用藍色真實。……明白。奠定足夠的基礎，從基本來進攻吧。……哪怕沒有偵探權限什麼的玩意，也是算不上障礙的。畢竟，也就僅僅是在以跟往昔戰人相同的條件地戰罷了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「而要诱他爆料，乃是必须去运用蓝色真实。……明白。奠定足够的基础，从基本来进攻吧。……哪怕没有侦探权限什么的玩意，也是算不上障碍的。毕竟，也就仅仅是在以跟往昔战人相同的条件地战罢了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ed io dovrò generosamente usare la verità blu per fare in modo che li ripeta. ... Capisco. Iniziamo dalle basi. ... Il non possedere l'autorità del detective non è assolutamente uno svantaggio. Significa semplicemente che sto combattendo nelle stesse condizioni in cui si trovava Battler una volta."

Speaker: Dlanor
Steam (ST): "First, all of the rooms were closed rooms formed by the window locks and chain locks and the like, so that "interference from the outside would be {f:5:difficult}". The only exception is the parlor, where Rosa and Maria lay {f:5:dead}."
Umineko Project (UP): "First, all of the rooms employ window locks and chain locks...to form locked rooms in a way that would be "difficult to interfere with from the {f:5:outside}". The only exception is the parlor, where Rosa and Maria lay {f:5:dead}."

PC Japanese (JP): 「まず、全ての部屋は、窓の施錠とチェーンロック等による、“外部よりの干渉の困難な”方法によって密室を構築されていマシタ。唯一の例外は楼座と真里亞の死んでいた客間のみデス。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「まず、全ての部屋は、窓の施錠とチェーンロック等による、“外部よりの干渉の困難な”方法によって密室を構築されていマシタ。唯一の例外は楼座と真里亞の死んでいた客間のみデス」
Russian (RU): "Во‐первых, все комнаты образуют закрытые комнаты с оконными замками и цепочками, поэтому *вмешательство {f:5:извне} осложняется*. Единственное исключение — гостиная, где лежат Роза и Мария."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Primeiro, todos os quartos utilizam de janelas trancadas e correntes de porta...para formar os quartos fechados de maneira que seja "difícil interferir neles pelo lado {f:5:exterior}". A única exceção é a sala de visitas, onde Rosa e Maria estão {f:5:mortas}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「首先，所有的房間，全是由窗戶的鎖與鏈條鎖等，“難以從外面干涉”的方法，被構築成了密室。唯一的例外是，樓座與真里亞斃命的客廳。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「首先，所有的房间，全是由窗户的锁与链条锁等，“难以从外面干涉”的方法，被构筑成了密室。唯一的例外是，楼座与真里亚毙命的客厅。」

Speaker: Dlanor
Steam (ST): "It is probably their goal to construct closed rooms where explanations using master keys are made completely {f:5:ineffective}. The parlor has no chain lock due to its very nature, so it is natural that something else would be used in the chain's {f:5:place}."
Umineko Project (UP): "It is probably his goal to construct locked rooms where explanations using master keys are made completely {f:5:ineffective}. The parlor has no chain lock due to its very nature, so it is natural that something else would be used in place of a {f:5:chain}."

PC Japanese (JP): 「マスターキーによる解釈を完全に封じた密室を構成するためでショウ。客間の性格上、チェーンロックがないため、他の何かで代用することも自然デス。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「マスターキーによる解釈を完全に封じた密室を構成するためでショウ。客間の性格上、チェーンロックがないため、他の何かで代用することも自然デス」

Speaker: Furudo Erika

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "In that case, even though it should've been more beautiful to throw them in there, so that everyone would be inside a chain lock closed room, they did not. ...That hat stand door bar in the parlor seems very suspicious. I should probably pursue this when demanding red truths. Also, we have corpses, ...but are they the same absolute deaths with their necks sliced open like in the last game, which could be confirmed even without the detective's authority?"
Umineko Project (UP): "In that case, it would have been more aesthetically pleasing to lock them in there, so that everyone would be inside a room locked by a chain, yet he did not do that. ......This hat stand door bar in the parlor seems very suspicious. I should probably investigate it thoroughly with repetition requests. Also, regarding the bodies, ......in the last game, their throats were sliced wide open...to the point that the deaths could be confirmed with certainty even without the detective's authority, but was there anything like that this time around?"

Also, we have corpses, ......but are they the same absolute deaths with their necks sliced open like in the last game, which could be confirmed even without the detective's authority?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「なら、そこに閉じ込めれば、全員、チェーンロックの密室ということで、より美しかったはずなのに、それをしなかった。……どうもこの客間の、帽子掛けのかんぬきとやらが胡散臭いです。復唱要求でよく追求するべきでしょうね。あと、遺体なんですが、……前回の首がバッサリ！みたいに、探偵権限がなくとも、絶対の死亡を確認できるようなものはありましたか？」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「なら、そこに閉じ込めれば、全員、チェーンロックの密室ということで、より美しかったはずなのに、それをしなかった。……どうもこの客間の、帽子掛けのかんぬきとやらが胡散臭いです。復唱要求でよく追及するべきでしょうね。あと、遺体なんですが、……前回の首がバッサリ！　みたいに、探偵権限がなくとも、絶対の死亡を確認できるようなものはありましたか？」
Russian (RU): "Хотя было бы изящнее бросить их туда, чтобы все были в закрытых комнатах, запертых на цепочки, так не сделали. ......Стойка для шляп в гостиной выглядит очень подозрительно. Следует надавить на это, требуя красную правду. Также у нас есть трупы...... но точно ли это абсолютные смерти, которые можно подтвердить даже без полномочия детектива, как в случае с трупами из прошлой игры, у которых были вспороты шеи?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então, seria esteticamente muito mais agradável prendê‐las lá, assim todos ficariam dentro de quartos fechados por correntes, e mesmo assim ele optou por não fazer isso. ......Este cabideiro para chapéus utilizado como barra para trancar a porta da sala de visitas me parece muito suspeito. Eu provavelmente deveria investigar mais a fundo com a repetição requisitada. E mais, sobre os corpos, ......no último jogo, as gargantas estavam abertas...ao ponto de fazer com que as mortes fossem confirmadas com absoluta certeza, sem sequer precisar da autoridade do detetive, mas dessa vez não tivemos nada parecido?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那麼，明明關進這些房間裡，就所有人都是鏈條鎖密室，更顯精美了，可他卻沒這麼做。……看來，這客廳的叫帽架門閂的玩意很是可疑呢。當以要求複述來進行深究吧？然後是，遺體……這次有沒有像，上次的脖子大開口般，沒有偵探權限也能確證絕對死亡之處？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那么，明明关进这些房间里，就所有人都是链条锁密室，更显精美了，可他却没这么做。……看来，这客厅的叫帽架门闩的玩意很是可疑呢。当以要求复述来进行深究吧？然后是，遗体……这次有没有像，上次的脖子大开口般，没有侦探权限也能确证绝对死亡之处？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Allora, nonostante sarebbe stato molto più bello ficcarli tutti là, in modo che si trovassero in un'unica camera chiusa con la serratura a catena, non hanno fatto così. ... La sbarra costituita da un appendiabiti nel salotto sembra davvero sospetta. Forse dovrei concentrarmi su questo punto quando richiederò le verità rosse. Inoltre, abbiamo dei cadaveri... ma si trattano delle stesse morti assolute con le loro gole squarciate come nel gioco precedente, nel quale potevano essere confermate anche senza l'autorità del detective?"

Steam (ST): "Depending on what you say, yes. I have no obligation to respond to everything, and I won't reveal my reasons when I refuse."

Steam (ST): Dlanor spread out one of those scrolls that some official would always spread out when announcing the king in Western fairy tales, and read it aloud.
Umineko Project (UP): Dlanor unfurled the kind of scroll often depicted in Western fairy tales when an official reads a royal decree, and she read the contents aloud.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Dlanor spread out one of those scrolls that some official would always spread out when announcing the king in western fairy tales, and read it aloud.
PC Japanese (JP): ドラノールは、西洋のおとぎ話で、よく王様のお触れを読む役人が広げるような、あの丸まった羊皮紙のようなものを縦に広げ、それを読み上げた。
Russian (RU): Дланор раскрыла один из таких свитков, которые всегда раскрывали, когда объявляли короля в западных сказках, и зачитала вслух.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dlanor desenrolou uma espécie de pergaminho, daqueles muitas vezes retratados em contos de fadas ocidentais, em cenas que oficiais leem um decreto real, e leu seu conteúdo em voz alta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 德拉諾爾縱向拉開，恰似西洋童話中常見的宣讀國王告示的官吏所拿著的，很像那個羊皮紙卷的東西，朗讀起了上面的內容。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...In other words, no trickery done from the outside can construct a closed room. It is not permitted for a chain lock to be reset from the outside by a cleverly used wire, for example."
Umineko Project (UP): "......In other words, no trickery done from the outside can construct a locked room. It isn't permitted for a chain lock to be reset from the outside by a skillfully used wire, for example."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......In other words, no trickery done from the outside can construct a closed room. It is not permitted for a chain lock to be reset from the outside by a skillfully used wire, for example."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……つまり、外部からはどんな細工でも、密室を構築できないということ。チェーンロックを外部より、細い針金などで器用に掛け直した、などは認められないということです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……つまり、外部からはどんな細工でも、密室を構築できないということ。チェーンロックを外部より、細い針金などで器用に掛け直した、などは認められないということです」
Russian (RU): "......То есть, нельзя ловко образовать закрытую комнату снаружи. Цепочку запрещено умело сбрасывать извне с помощью проволоки, например."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Em outras palavras, nenhum artifício conduzido pelo lado de fora é capaz de construir um quarto fechado. Por exemplo, não é permitido que uma corrente de porta seja removida pelo lado de fora com uma engenhosa utilização de um arame."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……這也就是說，從外面實行的任何把戲，皆是無法構築密室。從外面用細鐵絲等工具重新巧妙鎖好鏈條鎖什麼的，是不會得到認可的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……这也就是说，从外面实行的任何把戏，皆是无法构筑密室。从外面用细铁丝等工具重新巧妙锁好链条锁什么的，是不会得到认可的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... In altre parole, nessun inganno perpetrato dall'esterno può costituire una camera chiusa. Per esempio, non è permesso che la serratura di una catena venga regolata dall'esterno tramite un filo metallico utilizzato con abilità."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Terceiro. "A definição de quarto fechado implica que todas as formas de interferência entre interior e exterior do quarto sejam {f:5:prevenidas}"."

Steam (ST): In this way, they could confirm whether or not the culprit had been hiding inside a closed room.
Umineko Project (UP): This was to check that the murderer hadn't been hiding inside a locked room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In this way, they could check whether or not the culprit had been hiding inside a closed room.
PC Japanese (JP): これは、殺人犯が密室内に隠れていなかったことの確認だ。
Russian (RU): Так они могли проверить, не скрывался ли преступник в закрытой комнате.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isto é para verificar se o assassino não estava se escondendo dentro do quarto fechado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是為確證，殺人犯並未躲藏在密室之中。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是为确证，杀人犯并未躲藏在密室之中。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In questo modo, potevano verificare se il colpevole si stesse nascondendo o meno dentro una delle stanze chiuse.

Steam (ST): If the culprit had slipped out of the room after the discoverers had noticed the murders and then walked away, it would have been possible to construct an illusion of a closed room.
Umineko Project (UP): Because if the discoverers departed the scene after becoming aware of the locked‐room murder, and then the culprit slipped out of the room after that, it would have been possible to construct an illusion of a locked room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If the culprit had slipped out of the room after the discoverers had noticed the murders and then walked away, it would have been possible to construct an illusion of a closed room.
PC Japanese (JP): 密室殺人を発見者たちが認識して立ち去った後に、こっそりと部屋を抜け出せば、密室幻想を生み出すことは可能なのだから。
Russian (RU): Если он выскочил из комнаты после обнаружения преступления и ушёл, становится возможно создать иллюзию закрытого помещения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque, se os descobridores tiverem deixado a cena após ficarem cientes do assassinato de quarto fechado, e assim o culpado escapasse para fora do quarto logo depois, seria possível construir a ilusão de um quarto fechado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 畢竟，殺人犯只需在發現者們以為此乃密室殺人出門離去後，偷偷地溜出房間，即能夠創造出密室幻想。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 毕竟，杀人犯只需在发现者们以为此乃密室杀人出门离去后，偷偷地溜出房间，即能够创造出密室幻想。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Se il colpevole fosse scappato via dalla stanza dopo che gli scopritori notarono gli omicidi e se ne andarono, sarebbe stato possibile costruire l'illusione di una stanza chiusa.

Steam (ST): Because Battler had acknowledged their statement with the red truth, the possibility that the culprit and the victim had both been inside the closed room at the time of the crime, and that the culprit had hidden under the bed and snuck out after the discovery of the crime... had been denied.
Umineko Project (UP): Because Battler had acknowledged their statement with the red truth, this possibility—that the culprit and the victim had both been inside the locked room at the time of the crime, following which the culprit had hid under the bed and snuck out after the discovery of the crime—had now been eliminated.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because Battler had acknowledged their statement with the red truth, the possibility that the culprit and the victim had both been inside the closed room at the time of the crime, that the culprit had hid under the bed and snuck out after the discovery of the crime...... had been denied.
PC Japanese (JP): 戦人は、これを赤き真実で認めたため、犯人と犠牲者が２人で作った密室で殺人が起こり、犯人はベッドの下に隠れていて、事件発覚後にこっそりそこから抜け出した…、ということが否定された。
Russian (RU): Поскольку Баттлер признал их заявление красной правдой, возможность, что во время преступления убийца и жертва были в закрытой комнате и что преступник спрятался под кроватью, а после обнаружения преступления выскочил наружу...... была опровергнута.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como Battler reconheceu a afirmação delas usando a verdade vermelha, esta possibilidade — de que o culpado e a vítima estivessem ambos dentro do quarto fechado no momento do crime, e logo depois o culpado tenha se escondido debaixo da cama e escapado após a descoberta do crime — havia sido negada agora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於戰人以紅色真實給予了同意，所以，“犯人與犧牲者 2 人所構成的密室中發生殺人，犯人藏在床下，在眾人發現案發之後偷偷溜了出去…”的這一說法，是被否定了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于战人以红色真实给予了同意，所以，“犯人与牺牲者 2 人所构成的密室中发生杀人，犯人藏在床下，在众人发现案发之后偷偷溜了出去…”的这一说法，是被否定了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poiché Battler aveva confermato con la verità rossa la loro affermazione, la possibilità che il colpevole e la vittima fossero stati entrambi nella stanza chiusa al momento del crimine, che il colpevole si fosse nascosto sotto il letto e fosse sgattaiolato fuori dopo la scoperta del crimine... era stata negata.

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "...Why? Because the victims really were alive after the closed rooms were destroyed? So, Krauss and the others who barged in were the culprits and committed the murders then. In other words, they were post-closed room murders. Is that why you refuse...?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "......Why? Because the victims really were alive at the point when the locked rooms were destroyed? And the culprits were actually Krauss and the others who crowded in, who committed the murders then and there. In other words, because it was a murder after the locked room was destroyed. Is that the truth behind this...?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Why? Because the victims really were alive after the closed rooms were destroyed? So, Krauss and the others who crowded in were the culprits and committed the murders then. In other words, it was a murder after the closed rooms. Is it because this is the truth...?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……なぜです？　実は密室を破った時点では、犠牲者たちが生きてたからですか？　そして、実は押し入った蔵臼たちが犯人で、そこで殺人を行なった。即ち、密室後殺人だから。これが真相だからですか…？！」
Russian (RU): "......Почему? Потому что после открытия закрытых комнат жертвы и вправду были живы? Тогда убийства совершили столпившиеся там Краусс и другие. Выходит, убийства были совершены после открытия закрытых комнат. Всё потому, что это правда?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Por quê? Porque as vítimas estavam realmente vivas no momento em que os quartos fechados foram descobertos? E os culpados, aqueles que cometeram os crimes, são na verdade Krauss e todos os outros que se aglomeraram na cena. Em outras palavras, por ter sido um assassinato que ocorreu após a destruição do quarto fechado. Essa é a verdade por trás de tudo...?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……為什麼？是因為，其實在密室被破時，犧牲者們還活著嗎？然後，其實衝進來的藏臼等人才是犯人，在此時進行了殺人。即，密室後殺人。是因為，這就是真相嗎…？！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……为什么？是因为，其实在密室被破时，牺牲者们还活着吗？然后，其实冲进来的藏臼等人才是犯人，在此时进行了杀人。即，密室后杀人。是因为，这就是真相吗…？！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Perché? Perché in realtà, dopo la distruzione delle stanze chiuse, le vittime erano vive? Quindi, Krauss e gli altri che si erano accalcati nelle stanze sono i colpevoli e hanno commesso gli omicidi. In altre parole, si è trattato di un omicidio dopo le stanze chiuse. È così perché la verità è questa...?!"

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Però, Krauss Nii-san...! Questa è la riunione di famiglia, giusto?! Il giorno più importante dell'anno, no?! Perché Gohda-san è stato lasciato come unica persona con il turno nella villa...?! Se ci fosse stata una sola persona in più, sarebbe stato tutto diverso, non è così?! Vero? Vero?!"

Steam (ST): With a half-crying, half-enraged jumbled-up expression, Hideyoshi yelled at Gohda.
Umineko Project (UP): With a half‐crying, half‐enraged jumbled up expression, Hideyoshi yelled at Gohda.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With a half-crying, half-enraged jumbled up expression, Hideyoshi yelled at Gohda.
PC Japanese (JP): 泣き出しそうな、そして怒り出しそうな、あらゆる感情のごちゃ混ぜになった顔で、秀吉は郷田に食って掛かる。
Russian (RU): С наполовину разъярённым, наполовину плачущим выражением Хидэёши накричал на Году.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com uma expressão desordenada, quase que aos prantos, quase que estourando de raiva, Hideyoshi gritou com Gohda.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 以一張瀕臨哭出來的，瀕臨勃然大怒的，混合了各種各樣的感情的臉，秀吉炮轟鄉田。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 以一张濒临哭出来的，濒临勃然大怒的，混合了各种各样的感情的脸，秀吉炮轰乡田。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Con un'espressione confusa, per metà triste, per metà infuriata, Hideyoshi gridò contro Gohda.

Steam (ST): Of course, the culprit who killed everyone was the most to blame and the most despicable.
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, the culprit who killed everyone was the most to blame and the most despicable.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, the culprit who killed everyone was the most to blame and the most despicable.
PC Japanese (JP): 殺した犯人が一番悪くて憎いに決まってる。
Russian (RU): Конечно же, это преступник, убивший всех, был самым виноватым и презренным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, o assassino que matou todos é o mais culpado e também mais desprezível.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 毫無疑問，殺人凶手最壞最可恨。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 毫无疑问，杀人凶手最坏最可恨。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ovviamente, il colpevole che aveva ucciso tutti era colui che avrebbero dovuto incolpare maggiormente e il più spregevole.

Steam (ST): ...However, even if he understood that, he needed to let off some of his emotions by hating someone he could see.
Umineko Project (UP): ......However, even if he understood that, he needed to let off some of his emotions by hating someone he could see.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Porém, mesmo que ele entendesse isso, ele precisava extravasar suas emoções, odiando alguém que estivesse ao seu alcance.

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "...I am fully aware of how everyone feels. ...However, please calm down.
Umineko Project (UP): "............I understand how distressing this must be for all of you. ......However, please calm down."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I am fully aware of how everyone feels. ......However, please calm down.

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): ...Either Gohda-san wasn't thorough when locking up, ...or someone let Battler-san and Maria-san in after they came back from the guesthouse, and then forgot to lock up afterwards. ...However, that doesn't necessarily have anything to do with how the culprit snuck in."
Umineko Project (UP): "......I don't know whether Gohda‐san wasn't thorough enough when locking up, ......or whether someone let Battler‐san and Maria‐san in after they came back from the guesthouse, and then forgot to lock up afterwards. ......But whatever the case, it doesn't necessarily have anything to do with how the mysterious culprit snuck in."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Either Gohda-san wasn't thorough when locking up, ......or someone let Battler-san and Maria-san in after they came back from the guesthouse, and then forgot to lock up afterwards. ......However, that doesn't necessarily have anything to do with how the culprit snuck in."
PC Japanese (JP): ……郷田さんの戸締りが不完全だったか。……あるいは、ゲストハウスから戻ってきた、戦人さんと真里亞さんを誰かが迎え入れて、その後、施錠し忘れたのかはわかりません。……ただ、それが謎の犯人の侵入と関係があったとは限りません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……郷田さんの戸締りが不完全だったか。……あるいは、ゲストハウスから戻ってきた、戦人さんと真里亞さんを誰かが迎え入れて、その後、施錠し忘れたのかはわかりません。……ただ、それが謎の犯人の侵入と関係があったとは限りません」
Russian (RU): "......Либо Года не всё запер...... либо кто‐то впустил Баттлера и Марию, когда они вернулись из домика для гостей, а потом забыл запереть. ......Однако это не обязательно связано с проникновением преступника."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu não sei se o Gohda‐san não foi cuidadoso o bastante quando trancou tudo, ......ou se alguém deixou o Battler‐san e a Maria‐san entrarem depois que eles voltaram da casa de hóspedes, e esqueceu de fechar depois. ......Mas, seja qual for o caso, isso necessariamente não tem relação com a forma como o misterioso culpado entrou."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……雖不知道，是不是鄉田先生沒全鎖好，……又或許是，誰迎入了從賓館回來的戰人與真里亞後，忘了鎖門。……不過，這些並不一定與神秘凶手的侵入有關。」

O Gohda-san non è stato accurato nell'aver chiuso a chiave... o qualcuno ha lasciato entrare Battler-san e Maria-san, che erano tornati qui dalla casa degli ospiti, e in seguito si è dimenticato di chiudere. ... Malgrado ciò, non deve per forza avere qualcosa a che fare con il modo in cui il colpevole è entrato."

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "...After all, the mansion is massive. They might have come in much earlier and hid until late at night for all we know. ...I can understand that you might want to suspect certain people, but please calm down."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……何しろ、あれだけの大きなお屋敷です。もっと早い段階から屋敷に入り、ずっと深夜までどこかの部屋で息を殺していたのかもしれません。……誰かを疑いたい気持ちはわかりますが、どうか落ち着いて下さい」
Russian (RU): "......В конце концов, особняк огромен. Можно было войти гораздо раньше и прятаться до поздней ночи, насколько нам известно. ......Я понимаю ваше желание подозревать определённых людей, но, прошу, успокойтесь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Afinal, aquela mansão é imensa. Ele pode ter vindo muito mais cedo e se escondido até tarde da noite sem que ficássemos sabendo. ......Eu consigo entender o desejo de suspeitar de alguém, mas peço que se acalmem."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……毕竟，是这么大的一间大屋。有可能，是在更早的时候进了大屋，在某处一直压低呼吸藏到了深夜。……虽然我理解各位想去怀疑谁的心情，但请千万镇静下来。」

However, we must take the initiative now and regain our composure."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……客人の言うとおりだ。……憎むべきは犯人であって、……たまたま当番だった郷田ではない…。……とにかく、落ち着こう。……私とて悔しい。だが、今は我々が率先して冷静さを取り戻さなくては、どうしようもない。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……客人の言うとおりだ。……憎むべきは犯人であって、……たまたま当番だった郷田ではない…。……とにかく、落ち着こう。……私とて悔しい。だが、今は我々が率先して冷静さを取り戻さなくては、どうしようもない」
Russian (RU): "......Наша гостья права. ......Надо ненавидеть преступника, а не слугу, который просто оказался на дежурстве......... Давайте успокоимся. ......Мне так же тяжело, как всем остальным. Но сейчас мы должны взять инициативу в свои руки и собраться с духом."

Mas nós devemos tomar a iniciativa e recuperarmos nossas composturas."

Steam (ST): "...H-He's right. ...I still have George. Krauss nii-san still has Jessica-chan. And Rudolf-kun, you still have Ange-chan waitin' for you to return, right? It's still...too soon...to start pointin' fingers..."

PC Japanese (JP): 「……そ、……そや。……わしにも譲治がおる。蔵臼兄さんには朱志香ちゃんがおる。そして留弗夫くんも、帰りを待つ縁寿ちゃんがおるはずや。犯人と刺し違えたるッ、思うんは、……まだ、…早いんや……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……そ、……そや。……わしにも譲治がおる。蔵臼兄さんには朱志香ちゃんがおる。そして留弗夫くんも、帰りを待つ縁寿ちゃんがおるはずや。犯人と刺し違えたるッ、思うんは、……まだ、…早いんや……」
Russian (RU): "......О... ......он прав. ......У меня ещё есть Джордж. У Краусса есть Джессика. И, Рудольф, у тебя ещё есть Энджи, которая ждёт твоего возвращения. Пока ещё...... слишком рано... опускать руки......"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Sim......ele tem razão. ......Eu ainda tenho o George. O Krauss nii‐san tem a Jessica‐chan. E o Rudolf‐kun, ...ainda tem a Ange‐chan, esperando você voltar para casa, não tem? Ainda é......muito cedo...para arriscar tudo só para encontrar o culpado......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……是、……是吶。……俺還有讓治。藏臼兄還有朱志香。而留弗夫君，也是有等著你回去的小緣壽吶。去想，和犯人同歸於盡，……就……太早了吶……」

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... H... Ha ragione. ... Ho ancora George. Krauss Nii-san ha ancora Jessica-chan. {n}E Rudolf-kun... tu hai ancora Ange-chan che aspetta il tuo ritorno, giusto? {n}È ancora... troppo presto... per iniziare a puntare il dito contro le persone..."

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「好……好的…！大伙也定是心裡很亂吧……！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「好……好的…！大伙也定是心里很乱吧……！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "S... Sì...! Sì, sono certo che siano tutti parecchio agitati...!"

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Steam (ST): "......Are you certain? ...Is there anything else we can help with?"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Are you certain? ......Is there nothing more we can help with?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Are you certain? ......Is there anything else we can help with?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………よろしいのですか。……何かお手伝いできることは他にありませんか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………よろしいのですか。……何かお手伝いできることは他にありませんか」
Russian (RU): ".........Вы уверены?......Мы можем помочь ещё с чем‐нибудь?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Tem certeza? ......Não há mais nada que possamos fazer para ajudar?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………可以了嗎？……請問，沒有其他需要幫忙之處嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………可以了吗？……请问，没有其他需要帮忙之处吗？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Ne è sicura? ... C'è nient'altro che possiamo fare per aiutare?"

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "That's why I want you to go with Krauss-san. I want you there to help him if something happens. ...I'd like for the rest of us to check and see that everything's locked up here. We'll head up soon, so please go on ahead."
Umineko Project (UP): "That's the very reason I want you to go with Krauss‐san. I want you there to help him if something happens. ......I'd like for the rest of us to check that everything's locked up here. We'll head up soon, so please go on ahead."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That's why I want you to go with Krauss-san. I want you there to help him if something happens. ......I'd like for the rest of us to check and see that everything's locked up here. We'll head up soon, so please go on ahead."
PC Japanese (JP): 「だからこそ、蔵臼さんと一緒にいて下さい。何かの時、すぐにそれに応えられるように。……私たちは先に、ここの戸締りを確認したいと思います。すぐに上がりますから、先に行って下さい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「だからこそ、蔵臼さんと一緒にいて下さい。何かの時、すぐにそれに応えられるように。……私たちは先に、ここの戸締りを確認したいと思います。すぐに上がりますから、先に行って下さい」
Russian (RU): "Как раз поэтому я и хочу, чтобы вы пошли с Крауссом. Так вы поможете ему, если что случится. ......Остальным из нас стоит проверить, всё ли здесь заперто. Мы скоро придём, идите вперёд."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É exatamente por isso que eu quero que você vá com o Krauss‐san. Quero que esteja lá para ajudá‐lo caso algo aconteça. ......Eu gostaria que o resto de nós conferisse para ver se tudo está trancado. Iremos logo mais, então vão na frente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「都說了，請去陪同藏臼先生。在發生什麼時，也好立即做出對應。……我打算，我們先檢查下此處的門窗有沒鎖好。馬上就會上樓的，請先走一步吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「都说了，请去陪同藏臼先生。在发生什么时，也好立即做出对应。……我打算，我们先检查下此处的门窗有没锁好。马上就会上楼的，请先走一步吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ecco perché voglio che andiate con Krauss-san. Voglio che lo aiutiate nel caso succeda qualcosa. ... Vorrei che il resto di noi andasse a controllare che sia tutto chiuso a chiave di sopra. Presto andremo su, quindi vi prego di precederci."

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Steam (ST): "Understood... ...If you need anything, please call us."
Umineko Project (UP): "Understood...... ......If you need anything, please call us."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Understood............If you need anything, please call us."
PC Japanese (JP): 「わかりました……。……何かございましたら、お呼び下さい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「わかりました……。……何かございましたら、お呼び下さい」
Russian (RU): "Как скажете............ Зовите нас, если вам что‐нибудь понадобится."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Entendido...... ......Se precisar de qualquer coisa, por favor, nos chame."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「明白了……。……如有什麼事的話，請來叫我。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「明白了……。……如有什么事的话，请来叫我。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ho capito... se le serve qualcosa, la prego di chiamarci."

Steam (ST): Genji bowed, and Krauss nodded.
Umineko Project (UP): Genji bowed and nodded to Krauss.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji bowed, and Krauss nodded.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次は一礼し、蔵臼に頷く。
Russian (RU): Генджи поклонился, и Краусс кивнул.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji se curvou e assentiu para Krauss.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次行了一禮，藏臼點了點頭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次行了一礼，藏臼点了点头。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Genji fece un inchino, e Krauss annuì.

Steam (ST): Krauss also nodded to Erika, then headed up to the second floor with Genji and Gohda.
Umineko Project (UP): Krauss nodded to Erika, then headed upstairs with Genji and Gohda.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Krauss also nodded to Erika, then headed up to the second floor with Genji and Gohda.
PC Japanese (JP): 蔵臼も、ヱリカに頷き、源次と郷田を伴い、２階へ上がっていった。
Russian (RU): Он кивнул и Эрике, а затем пошёл на второй этаж вместе с Генджи и Годой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Krauss assentiu para Erika, e assim subiu as escadas com Genji e Gohda.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著藏臼再對繪梨花也點了下頭後，帶領著源次與鄉田，上了 2 樓。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着藏臼再对绘梨花也点了下头后，带领着源次与乡田，上了 2 楼。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Krauss annuì anche ad Erika, poi si diresse al primo piano con Genji e Gohda.

Steam (ST): ...In times of confusion, when only men are around, it's easy for a composed member of the opposite sex to take the initiative.
Umineko Project (UP): .........When only men are around in a time of confusion, it is easy for a composed member of the opposite sex to control the initiative.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......In times of confusion, when only men are around, it is easy for a composed member of the opposite sex to control the initiative.
PC Japanese (JP): ………男だけの、混迷した現場で、冷静さを持つ異性は、イニシアチブをコントロールしやすい。
Russian (RU): ......Во время замешательства, когда вокруг только мужчины, сдержанный член противоположного пола легко может управлять инициативой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Quando só há homens por perto em momentos de confusão como esse, é fácil para um membro calmo do sexo oposto tomar a iniciativa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………在只有男性的混亂現場，具冷靜風範的異性，能輕鬆控制主導權。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………在只有男性的混乱现场，具冷静风范的异性，能轻松控制主导权。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Nei momenti di confusione, quando ci sono soltanto uomini, è facile per una donna, potere avere l'iniziativa.

Steam (ST): Even without the detective's authority, she was able to control them quite naturally.
Umineko Project (UP): Even without the detective's authority, she was able to control them quite naturally.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even without the detective's authority, she was able to control them quite naturally.
PC Japanese (JP): 探偵権限がなくとも、とても自然な、見事なコントロールだった。
Russian (RU): Даже без полномочия детектива она могла вполне естественно контролировать их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo sem a autoridade do detetive, ela foi capaz de controlar tudo naturalmente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 即便沒有偵探權限，她也非常自然且漂亮地掌控了全局。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 即便没有侦探权限，她也非常自然且漂亮地掌控了全局。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche senza l'autorità del detective, era stata in grado di controllarli quasi naturalmente.

Steam (ST): Erika had wanted to get rid of the servants for the time being...
Umineko Project (UP): Erika had wanted to get rid of the servants for the time being......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Erika had wanted to get rid of the servants for the time being......
PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカはとりあえず、使用人たちを上へ追い払いたかったのだ……。
Russian (RU): Пока что Эрика хотела избавиться от служащих......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Erika queria se livrar dos serviçais por ora......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花是想，先把傭人們趕到樓上……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花是想，先把佣人们赶到楼上……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Erika aveva voluto sbarazzarsi dei domestici per il momento...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "Okay. In that case, let's get to checking the locks."
Umineko Project (UP): "Okay. In that case, let's get to checking the locks."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「よし。そうと来たら、さっそく戸締りを確認しようぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「よし。そうと来たら、さっそく戸締りを確認しようぜ」
Russian (RU): "Что ж. Давайте проверять замки."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Certo. Nesse caso, vamos conferir as trancas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「好。既然如此，那我們就趕緊開始檢查門窗有沒鎖好吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「好。既然如此，那我们就赶紧开始检查门窗有没锁好吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Bene. In tal caso, andiamo a controllare le serrature."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "Our problem's gonna be the big window in the lounge. It looks like it doesn't even have shutters. If they smash this, we won't be able to stop them from comin' in."
Umineko Project (UP): "The problem is the big window in the lounge. It looks like it doesn't even have shutters. If they smash this, we won't be able to stop them from comin' in."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「問題は、ラウンジのこの大窓やな。シャッターもないみたいや。ここをぶち破られたら侵入は防げんで。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「問題は、ラウンジのこの大窓やな。シャッターもないみたいや。ここをぶち破られたら侵入は防げんで」
Russian (RU): "Проблема — большое окно в холле. На нём даже нет ставен. Если его разобьют, мы не сможем предотвратить проникновение."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O problema é a grande janela do lounge. Parece que ela sequer tem venezianas. Se a quebrarem, não seremos capazes de impedir a entrada de ninguém."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「問題是，休息室的這扇大窗吶。好像，是連卷簾都麽有吶。此處被突破，是防不住侵入的吶。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「问题是，休息室的这扇大窗呐。好像，是连卷帘都么有呐。此处被突破，是防不住侵入的呐。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Il problema è la grande finestra nell'atrio. Sembra che non abbia neanche le persiane. Se viene rotta, non saremo in grado di impedire l'entrata di nessuno."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "Don't worry, the sound of the glass smashing will be more than enough warning. We'll turn them to Swiss cheese!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Don't worry, the sound of the glass smashing will be more than enough warning. We'll turn them to Swiss cheese!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいさ、ガラスの割れる音で充分だぜ。蜂の巣にしてやらぁ！」
Russian (RU): "Ничего, треска для предупреждения будет более чем достаточно. Мы сделаем из преступника швейцарский сыр!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não se preocupe, o som do vidro quebrando seria um alarme mais do que suficiente. Nós os transformaríamos em queijo suíço!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「沒事，有玻璃碎掉的聲音就夠了。把犯人射成馬蜂窩！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「没事，有玻璃碎掉的声音就够了。把犯人射成马蜂窝！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non preoccuparti, il suono del vetro infranto sarà un allarme più che sufficiente. Li faremo diventare come un groviera svizzero!"

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "...Quiet, please. I didn't have you stay down here to check the doors and windows. ...Please listen calmly to what I'm about to say."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Quiet, please. I didn't have you stay down here to check the doors and windows. ......Please listen calmly to what I'm about to say."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……お静かに。皆さんに残ってもらったのは、戸締りの確認のためではありません。……今から言うことを、冷静に聞いて下さい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……お静かに。皆さんに残ってもらったのは、戸締りの確認のためではありません。……今から言うことを、冷静に聞いて下さい」
Russian (RU): "......Тише. Не нужно проверять двери и окна. ......Послушайте."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Fiquem quietos. Eu não pedi para que ficassem aqui para conferir portas e janelas. ......Ouçam atentamente o que eu estou para dizer, por favor."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……請安靜。叫大家留在這裡，並不是為了檢查門窗有沒鎖好。……請冷靜聆聽，我接下來所講的話。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……请安静。叫大家留在这里，并不是为了检查门窗有没锁好。……请冷静聆听，我接下来所讲的话。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Calmatevi, per favore. Non vi ho fatti rimanere qui per controllare porte e finestre. ... Per favore, ascoltate con calma ciò che sto per dirvi."

Steam (ST): When Erika lowered her voice, Rudolf and Hideyoshi realized that she wanted to talk about something secret, so they brought their ears closer as soon as they regained their composure...
Umineko Project (UP): When Erika lowered her voice, Rudolf and Hideyoshi realized that she had something secret to talk about, so they brought their ears closer as soon as they regained their composure...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Erika lowered her voice, Rudolf and Hideyoshi realized that she was talking about something secret, so they brought their ears closer as soon as they regained their composure...
PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカが声を潜めると、留弗夫と秀吉も、何か秘密の話があると察知し、落ち着きを取り戻してから、耳を寄せる…。
Russian (RU): Когда Эрика понизила голос, Рудольф и Хидэёши поняли, что она имеет в виду нечто тайное, и приблизили уши, как только собрались с духом...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando Erika baixou o tom de sua voz, Rudolf e Hideyoshi perceberam que ela queria falar algo em segredo, por isso se aproximaram para ouvir assim que recuperaram suas composturas...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花一壓低聲音，留弗夫與秀吉也當即意識到是有什麼不可公開的話要講，沉心靜氣地把耳朵湊了過去…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花一压低声音，留弗夫与秀吉也当即意识到是有什么不可公开的话要讲，沉心静气地把耳朵凑了过去…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Come Erika abbassò la voce, Rudolf e Hideyoshi capirono che stava per parlare di qualcosa di segreto, perciò portarono le orecchie più vicino possibile non appena riacquistata la calma...

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "Listen up. This crime happened during a short break in the family conference. ...In that tiny span of time, six people were killed without anyone noticing. I can't imagine a crime improvised on the spot going so smoothly. This crime was committed by someone who knew the layout of this mansion well, inside and out."
Umineko Project (UP): "Are you ready? This crime happened during a short break in the family conference. ......In that tiny span of time, six people were killed without anyone noticing—I can't imagine that was the result of any haphazard crime. This crime was committed by someone who knew the layout of this mansion well, inside and out."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Listen up. This crime happened during the short break in the family conference. ......In that tiny span of time, six people were killed without anyone noticing. I can't imagine that was the result of any haphazard crime. This crime was committed by someone who knew the layout of this mansion well, inside and out."
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいですか？　事件は、親族会議の小休止中という、わずかの時間の間に起こりました。……そのわずかの時間中に、誰にも悟られずに６人もの人間を殺すなど、到底、場当たり的な犯行とは思えません。これは、屋敷の内外の構造を知り尽くした、関係者の犯行です。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いいですか？　事件は、親族会議の小休止中という、わずかの時間の間に起こりました。……そのわずかの時間中に、誰にも悟られずに６人もの人間を殺すなど、到底、場当たり的な犯行とは思えません。これは、屋敷の内外の構造を知り尽くした、関係者の犯行です」
Russian (RU): "Смотрите. Преступление произошло во время короткого перерыва на семейном собрании. ......За такой крошечный промежуток времени убили шесть человек, и никто не заметил. Не представляю, что это результат спонтанного преступления. Преступление совершил тот, кто хорошо знает структуру особняка и внутри, и снаружи."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você está bem? O crime ocorreu durante o curto intervalo da conferência familiar. ......Em um pequeno espaço de tempo, seis pessoas foram mortas sem que ninguém percebesse — eu não consigo imaginar que seja o resultado de um crime desordenado. Este crime foi cometido por alguém que conhecia muito bem o layout desta mansão, por dentro e por fora."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「聽好了。事件是在親族會議的稍事休息，這個極短的時間中所發生的。……在這段極短的時間中，不被任何人察覺地殺死 6 個人，無論如何都無法與即興犯罪聯繫起來。這個是，對大屋內外構造了如指掌的相關人員犯的案。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「听好了。事件是在亲族会议的稍事休息，这个极短的时间中所发生的。……在这段极短的时间中，不被任何人察觉地杀死 6 个人，无论如何都无法与即兴犯罪联系起来。这个是，对大屋内外构造了如指掌的相关人员犯的案。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ascoltate. Questo crimine è avvenuto durante la breve pausa nella conferenza di famiglia. ... In quel piccolo lasso di tempo, sei persone sono state uccise senza che nessuno se ne accorgesse. Non riesco a immaginare che possa essere il frutto di un qualsiasi crimine d'istinto. Questo delitto è stato commesso da qualcuno che conosceva bene la pianta di questa villa, in ogni suo punto."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "...W-Well, if they didn't know the inside well... B-But..."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........S‐sure, if they didn't know the inside well, then...... B‐but still......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......W, well, if they didn't know the inside well...... B, but......"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………そ、そら内部に詳しゅうなかったら……。し、しかし……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………そ、そら内部に詳しゅうなかったら……。し、しかし……」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........C‐Claro, se não conhecer bem o interior, então...... M‐Mas, mesmo assim......"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………这、这个倒是，如果对内部不熟悉……。可、可是……」

Steam (ST): A short while ago, they had attacked Gohda, suspecting the servants of making a blunder.
Umineko Project (UP): A short while ago, they had lambasted Gohda, suspecting the servants of having made a blunder.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A short while ago, they had attacked Gohda, suspecting the servants of making a blunder.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼らはさっきまで、郷田などの使用人の過失を疑い、責めていた。
Russian (RU): Недавно они напали на Году, подозревая слуг в ошибке.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pouco tempo atrás, pressionaram Gohda, suspeitando dos serviçais terem cometido um erro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他們剛才曾，懷疑鄉田等傭人犯有過失，責備傭人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他们刚才曾，怀疑乡田等佣人犯有过失，责备佣人。

Steam (ST): However, they'd only thought that he'd forgotten to lock up, and were attacking him for letting the mysterious culprit sneak in. ...They hadn't considered that one of the servants they knew so well might've taken those lives with their own hands.
Umineko Project (UP): However, they had only thought that he had forgotten to lock up, and were attacking him for letting the mysterious culprit sneak in. .........They hadn't considered that one of the servants they knew so well might have taken those lives with their own hands.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, they had only thought that he had forgotten to lock up, and were attacking him for letting the mysterious culprit sneak in. ......They hadn't considered that one of the servants they knew so well might have taken those lives with their own hands.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしそれは、施錠のし忘れを疑い、それが謎の犯人の侵入を許したのではないかと責めているだけで、………よく見知った使用人たちの誰かが、その手で命を奪ったとまでは、思い至っていない。
Russian (RU): Но они лишь подумали, что он забыл запереть, и набросились на него потому, что он впустил таинственного преступника. ......Они не считали, что кто‐то из слуг, которых они так хорошо знают, мог забрать эти жизни своими руками.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Contudo, eles apenas pensaram que ele havia esquecido de fechar, e estavam atacando ele por ter deixado um culpado misterioso entrar. .........Eles não consideraram que um dos serviçais que eles conheciam tão bem pudesse ter tomado todas aquelas vidas com as próprias mãos.

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "At the time of the crime, the mansion was locked from the inside, and only those involved with the family conference existed there."
Umineko Project (UP): "At the time of the crime, the mansion was locked from the inside, and only those involved with the family conference existed there."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「犯行当時。屋敷は内部より施錠され、親族会議にかかわる皆さんしか存在しませんでした」

Steam (ST): "So, Aniki killed Kyrie and the others?! Or am I supposed to suspect Hideyoshi nii-san?! It's impossible, ...unthinkable!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "So, what, you're saying {i:Aniki} killed Kyrie and the others?! Or am I supposed to suspect Hideyoshi nii‐san?! It's impossible, unthinkable!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "So, Aniki killed Kyrie and the others?! Or am I supposed to suspect Hideyoshi nii-san?! It's impossible...unthinkable!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「じゃあ兄貴が霧江たちを殺したってのか？！　それとも秀吉兄さんを疑えってのか？！　ありえねぇ、考えられねぇ！！」
Russian (RU): "Значит, {i:брат} убил Кирие и других?! Или мне подозревать Хидэёши?! Это невозможно... немыслимо!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então, você está dizendo que o {i:aniki} matou a Kyrie e as outras?! Ou eu deveria suspeitar do Hideyoshi nii‐san?! É impossível, impensável!!"

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Perciò, Aniki ha ucciso Kyrie e gli altri?! O dovrei sospettare di Hideyoshi Nii-san?! È impossibile... impensabile!!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "I never even considered suspectin' Krauss nii-san or Rudolf-kun...!! All of the siblings had excellent relationships with their spouses! True, the Ushiromiya family may be strict with discipline and money. But that doesn't mean we treasure our own families less than anyone else...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "I've never even considered suspectin' Krauss nii‐san or Rudolf‐kun...!! All of us siblings were happily married! True, the Ushiromiya family may be strict with discipline and money. But that doesn't mean we treasure our own families less than any other family would...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I've never even considered suspectin' Krauss nii-san or Rudolf-kun...!! All of the siblings had excellent relationships with their spouses! True, the Ushiromiya family may be strict with discipline and money. But that doesn't mean we treasure our own families less than any other family...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「わしはハナから蔵臼兄さんも留弗夫くんも疑っとらんで…？！　わしら兄弟は、みんな夫婦仲は円満や！　右代宮家は確かに、規律やカネには厳しい一族やで。しかしな、家族を大事にするっちゅう気持ちは、他の家に勝るとも劣らんつもりやで…！」
Russian (RU): "Я бы никогда не заподозрил Краусса или Рудольфа!.. У всех родственников прекрасные отношения с супругами! Да, семья Уширомия строга, когда дело касается дисциплины и денег. Но это не значит, что мы дорожим своими семьями меньше, чем любая другая семья!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu nunca, jamais, iria considerar que o Krauss nii‐san ou Rudolf‐kun são suspeitos...!! Todos os irmãos tinham ótimas relações com as esposas! É verdade, a família Ushiromiya podia ser bem rígida quando se trata de disciplina e dinheiro. Mas isso não quer dizer que nós não valorizamos nossas próprias famílias menos do que qualquer outra família...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「俺是一開始，就麽懷疑過藏臼兄與留弗夫君吶…？！俺們哥幾個，夫妻關係都很圓滿吶！右代宮家，的確是在規矩與錢上管很嚴的家族。但是吶，珍愛家人的那份心，跟其他家族比，俺認為只會贏不會輸…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「俺是一开始，就么怀疑过藏臼兄与留弗夫君呐…？！俺们哥几个，夫妻关系都很圆满呐！右代宫家，的确是在规矩与钱上管很严的家族。但是呐，珍爱家人的那份心，跟其他家族比，俺认为只会赢不会输…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non ho neanche mai considerato il sospettare Krauss Nii-san o Rudolf-kun...!! Tutti i fratelli avevano delle relazioni eccellenti con le proprie mogli! È vero, la famiglia Ushiromiya potrà anche essere severa con la disciplina e il denaro. {n}Ma questo non significa che facciamo tesoro delle nostre famiglie meno degli altri...!"

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non è un po' presto per sospettare Gohda-san?! Lui è venuto a portarci da bere in sala da pranzo durante la pausa. ... È stato con noi per parecchio tempo. {n}Non riesco a immaginare che avesse avuto il tempo di uccidere sei persone...!"

Steam (ST): Eva and Rosa were two of the siblings, but none of the others could've had any reason to kill Natsuhi, Kyrie, Battler, or the young Maria...
Umineko Project (UP): Although Eva and Rosa were part of the sibling circle of hate, there could be no reason for a sibling to kill any of the others who had died—Natsuhi, Kyrie, Battler, or the young Maria...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eva and Rosa were two of the siblings, but none of the others could have had any reason to kill Natsuhi, Kyrie, Battler, or the young Maria...
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽や楼座は兄弟の当事者ではあるが、夏妃や霧江、戦人や、幼い真里亞を殺す理由など、あろうはずもない…。
Russian (RU): Ева и Роза были сёстрами, но ни у кого другого не было причин убивать Нацухи, Кирие, Баттлера и маленькую Марию...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Embora Eva e Rosa fossem parte do círculo de ódio dos irmãos, não haviam motivos para um irmão ter matado aqueles que foram mortos — Natsuhi, Kyrie, Battler ou a jovem Maria...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然繪羽樓座可算是兄弟姐妹的當事人，但對於夏妃霧江，戰人與幼小的真里亞，就根本不可能會有要痛下殺手的理由…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然绘羽楼座可算是兄弟姐妹的当事人，但对于夏妃雾江，战人与幼小的真里亚，就根本不可能会有要痛下杀手的理由…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Eva e Rosa erano le due sorelle fra i quattro, ma nessun altro avrebbe avuto alcuna ragione di uccidere Natsuhi, Kyrie, Battler, o la giovane Maria...

Steam (ST): But...to a servant like Gohda, ...perhaps they were all little more than complete strangers......
Umineko Project (UP): But......to a servant like Gohda......perhaps everyone was little more than a complete stranger.........
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But......to a servant like Gohda......perhaps everyone was little more than a complete stranger.........
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、……使用人の郷田にとっては、……全員、アカの他人でしかない………？
Russian (RU): Однако...... для слуги вроде Годы...... все были практически незнакомцами.........
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas......para um serviçal como Gohda......talvez todos não fossem mais do que completos estranhos.........
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過……對傭人鄉田來說，……他們就全部都只是，無關外人嗎………？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过……对佣人乡田来说，……他们就全部都只是，无关外人吗………？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Però... per un domestico come Gohda... forse erano tutti poco più che semplici sconosciuti...

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "I suspect the servants on two points. First, the victims are familiar with them, and there were no signs of a fight in any of the crime scenes. I think you know well that there was no disturbance at any of those places."
Umineko Project (UP): "I suspect the servants on two counts. First, the victims are familiar with them, and there were no signs of a struggle at any of the crime scenes. I'm sure you're all well aware that none of the rooms were the least bit disturbed."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I suspect the servants on two points. First, the victims are familiar with them, and there were no signs of a fight in any of the crime scenes. I think you know well that there was no disturbance at any of those places."
PC Japanese (JP): 「私が使用人を疑う点は２点です。まず１点目は、犠牲者たちと面識があり、かつ何れの現場にも争った跡がないこと。全ての現場はまったく乱れていなかったのを、皆さんもよくご存知のはずです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私が使用人を疑う点は２点です。まず１点目は、犠牲者たちと面識があり、かつ何れの現場にも争った跡がないこと。全ての現場はまったく乱れていなかったのを、皆さんもよくご存知のはずです」
Russian (RU): "Я подозреваю слуг с двух точек зрения. Первая: жертвы были знакомы с ними, и поэтому ни на одном месте преступления не было признаков сопротивления. Вы тоже знаете, что в тех местах не было никаких нарушений."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu tenho duas suspeitas sobre os serviçais. Primeiro, as vítimas estavam familiarizadas com eles, e não havia sinais de resistência em nenhuma das cenas do crime. Eu tenho certeza de que vocês estão cientes que nenhum dos quartos estava minimamente perturbado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我懷疑傭人，是懷疑兩點。首先第 1 點是，與犧牲者們有面識，且每個現場都沒有扭打的痕跡。諸位也應該很清楚，所有的現場全無絲毫凌亂。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我怀疑佣人，是怀疑两点。首先第 1 点是，与牺牲者们有面识，且每个现场都没有扭打的痕迹。诸位也应该很清楚，所有的现场全无丝毫凌乱。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sospetto dei domestici per due motivi. Primo, le vittime li conoscevano bene, e non c'erano segni di lotta in alcuna delle scene del crimine. Credo che sappiate bene che non c'era nulla fuori posto in ognuno di quei luoghi."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "...I was thinking that too. ...Figured Kyrie was used enough to fights that she wouldn't get killed that easily, without resisting. That woman wouldn't hesitate to bite your finger off... It does make more sense if the culprit was someone she knew, who suddenly attacked when her guard was down..."
Umineko Project (UP): "......I thought that too. ......Kyrie's used to fighting, like hell she'd get killed that easily without resisting. That woman wouldn't hesitate to bite your finger off... It does make more sense if the culprit was someone she knew, who suddenly attacked when her guard was down..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I thought that too. ......Figured Kyrie was used to fights enough that she wouldn't get killed that easily, without resisting. That woman wouldn't hesitate to bite your finger off... It does make more sense if the culprit was someone she knew, who suddenly attacked when her guard was down..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……それは俺も思ってたぜ。……あの喧嘩慣れした霧江が、何の抵抗もなく、綺麗にぱったり殺されるかってんだ。相手の指くらいは食い千切る女だぜ…。顔見知りが犯人で、油断させたところを突然って方が、確かに説明はつく…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……それは俺も思ってたぜ。……あの喧嘩慣れした霧江が、何の抵抗もなく、綺麗にぱったり殺されるかってんだ。相手の指くらいは食い千切る女だぜ…。顔見知りが犯人で、油断させたところを突然って方が、確かに説明はつく…」
Russian (RU): "......Я тоже об этом думал. ......Полагаю, Кирие достаточно привыкла к стычкам, чтобы не дать убить себя без сопротивления. Эта женщина не постеснялась бы откусить другому палец... Разумнее предположить, что преступником был тот, кого она знала и кто неожиданно напал на неё, когда она потеряла бдительность..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu também pensei nisso. ......A Kyrie costumava lutar, então duvido que ela se permitisse ser morta facilmente sem uma boa briga. Aquela mulher não hesitaria em arrancar um dedo com a boca... Faz sentido que o culpado seja alguém que ela conheça bem, e que a atacou repentinamente quando ela baixou a guarda..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……這個，我也有想到。……那位打架老手霧江，竟會毫無抵抗，乾淨乾脆地被殺。她可是個，會把對方手指咬下來的女人啊…。按熟人是凶手，趁其不備突然下手，的確是能說得通…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……这个，我也有想到。……那位打架老手雾江，竟会毫无抵抗，干净干脆地被杀。她可是个，会把对方手指咬下来的女人啊…。按熟人是凶手，趁其不备突然下手，的确是能说得通…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... L'ho pensato anch'io. ... Immaginavo che Kyrie fosse abbastanza abituata alla lotta da non venir uccisa così facilmente, senza opporre resistenza. Quella donna non esiterebbe a staccarti un dito a morsi... ha più senso se il colpevole fosse qualcuno che lei conosceva, che l'ha attacca all'improvviso mentre aveva abbassato la guardia..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "C-Come to think of it, the same goes for my Eva... She knows a dozen kinds of martial arts. She spends every day practically wishin' for some ruffian to attack her. She wouldn't have been killed off so easily...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "C‐come to think of it, same goes for my Eva... She knows a dozen kinds of martial arts. She spends every day practically wishin' for some ruffian to attack her. She wouldn't have been killed off in a snap like that...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "C, come to think of it, same goes for my Eva... She knows a dozen kinds of martial arts. She spends every day practically wishin' for some ruffian to attack her. She wouldn't have been killed off so easily...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「そ、それを言ったら、うちの絵羽もや…。何しろ武芸百般。暴漢が襲ってこないかと、日々わくわくしとる女やで。そんなあっさりと殺されるわけがない…！」
Russian (RU): "К‐кстати, то же самое относится и к моей Еве... Она знала десятки видов боевых искусств. Будь её воля, она бы каждый день практиковалась на бандитах. Её бы не убили так просто!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "P‐Pensando nisso, o mesmo vale para a Eva... Ela sabe um bocado de artes marciais. E passava todo dia praticamente desejando que um vagabundo tentasse atacá‐la. A Eva não seria morta tão facilmente assim...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「提、提起這個，俺家的繪羽也一樣吶…。畢竟，她可是個會百般武藝，每天都雀躍盼著，是否會有歹徒來襲擊她的女人吶。不可能，被輕易殺死…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「提、提起这个，俺家的绘羽也一样呐…。毕竟，她可是个会百般武艺，每天都雀跃盼着，是否会有歹徒来袭击她的女人呐。不可能，被轻易杀死…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "A-Adesso che ci penso, la stessa cosa vale per la mia Eva... conosce una dozzina di arti marziali diverse. Trascorre ogni giorno praticamente sperando che qualche teppista la attacchi. Non sarebbe stata ammazzata così facilmente...!"

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "......Then what about Rosa-san, in the parlor? Do you think she'd be easily killed by a stranger, without resisting, while she had her only daughter with her? And this tells us something else that's important."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Then what about Rosa‐san, in the parlor? Do you think she would allow herself to be easily killed by a stranger, without resisting, while she had her only daughter with her? And this tells us something else that's important."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Then what about Rosa-san, in the parlor? Do you think she would be easily killed by a stranger, without resisting, while she had her only daughter with her? And this tells us something else that's important."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………なら客間の楼座さんだってどうです？　一人娘と一緒の楼座さんが、不審者相手に抵抗もせず、みすみすと殺されると思いますか？　そしてこのことは、もう一つ、大事なことを教えています。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………なら客間の楼座さんだってどうです？　一人娘と一緒の楼座さんが、不審者相手に抵抗もせず、みすみすと殺されると思いますか？　そしてこのことは、もう一つ、大事なことを教えています」
Russian (RU): ".........А Роза в гостиной? Думаете, незнакомец смог бы легко и не встретив сопротивления убить её с единственной дочерью? И это говорит нам ещё кое о чём важном."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........E quanto a Rosa‐san, na sala de visitas? Você acha que ela se deixaria ser morta tão facilmente por um estranho, sem tentar resistir, enquanto a única pessoa ao seu lado era a sua própria filha? E isso nos diz algo ainda mais importante."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………那麼，客廳的樓座夫人又如何呢？各位覺得與獨生女一起的樓座夫人，會毫不反抗可疑分子，眼睜睜地等死？而這件事，又告訴了我們一個重要的情報。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………那么，客厅的楼座夫人又如何呢？各位觉得与独生女一起的楼座夫人，会毫不反抗可疑分子，眼睁睁地等死？而这件事，又告诉了我们一个重要的情报。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... E allora che mi dite di Rosa-san, nel salotto? Credete che sarebbe stata uccisa agevolmente da uno estraneo, senza resistere, mentre aveva con sé la sua unica figlia? E questo ci dice un'altra cosa importante."

Steam (ST): "Somethin' important...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Somethin' important...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「重要的情报…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Qualcosa di importante...?"

Steam (ST): "......The culprit isn't just one person, right...?"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........There's more than one culprit..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........The culprit isn't just one person, right...?"
